Synths stretch and memories mutate in the must-listen new remix, which reimagines Chrystal's viral track into a haunting banger for bass music fans.

  • Home
  • MUSIC RELEASES

What happens when you remix a memory? KDrew and Rich DietZ have the answer.

They've teamed up to release a stunning remix of Chrystal's "The Days," out now via DJ Susan's PEAK DIAL. And the song's transformation is nothing short of masterful. 

Originally subtle and dreamlike, Chrystal's vocals are now entwined through drops that run roughshod with neurobass, labyrinths of intricate production that give them a new sense of urgency and allure. Her aching memories ("Do you think about the days when we sat down, smoking wine and drinking haze?") seep through the cracks of music with layers of complexity that reward deeper listening.

KDrew and DietZ take the gnawing nostalgia of these "days" and imbues it with spine-tingling intensity. It's like looking back at a simpler time, but through a lens that distorts reality—everything feels fuzzier, thicker and somehow more dangerous.

With swelling builds and palpitating bass you can feel in your chest cavity, KDrew’s hallmark precision and DietZ's signature energy meld to create a remix that thrives on tension. The beat feels almost alive, lurking beneath the surface and always threatening to burst into full chaos, but instead moves like a predator—always patient, always deliberate.

You can listen to the new remix below via SoundCloud.
